page.title: 12DINNER AND THE SCHOOL DINER
page.content: Surrey Street School children eat their meals in a quite unique collect- ion of decaying wartime woodwork which began its temporary service life more than forty years ago as a'communal feeding centre'.By 1945 there were 2000 of these centres which had become known as 'British Restaurants'serving half a million meals a day. Here as an adult in World War Two,and to supple- ment your wartime food rations,you could have bought a good two-course dinner for'ninepence'(less than 4 New Pence)with a choice of bacon savoury, haricot mutton,vegetable pie with a sauce,cabbage and potato,steam pudding and custard,or rice pudding.A child would have paid'fourpence'(less than 2 New Pence).The faithful old hulk will be demolished soon.A classroom is to be converted into a smart new kitchen and we shall dine in the Hall. {N.W.
